comments.text:
Created attachment 584876
Full output.log

When running the `nss/tests/all.sh' script after building, I get a total of 59 test-failures. The first two -- and they seems to repeat and be responsible for at least some of the subsequent ones -- read:

....
cert.sh: Creating an EC CA Certificate TestCA-ec ==========================
/mi/ports/security/nss/work/nss-3.13.1/mozilla/tests_results/security/utka.3/CA
cert.sh: Creating EC CA Cert TestCA-ec  --------------------------
certutil -s "CN=NSS Test CA (ECC), O=BOGUS NSS, L=Mountain View, ST=California, C=US" -S -n TestCA-ec -k ec -q secp521r1 -t CTu,CTu,CTu -v 60
0 -x -d . -1 -2 -5 -f ../tests.pw -z ../tests_noise -m 1


Generating key.  This may take a few moments...

certutil: signing of data failed: security library: invalid algorithm.
cert.sh: #59: Creating EC CA Cert TestCA-ec  (255=0)  - FAILED
cert.sh ERROR: Creating EC CA Cert TestCA-ec  failed 255
return value is 255
cert.sh: Exit: 6 Fatal - failed to create EC CA cert - FAILED
cert.sh: #60: 6 Fatal - failed to create EC CA cert - FAILED
TIMESTAMP cert END: чт 29 гру 2011 18:33:19 EST

The failures are the same even after I perform a full install of the freshly-built binaries, so this is not the case of the older installed version interfering with the test of the newly-built one...
